content.description: Sharp tricky start to pumpy face climbing.
content.location: Left most route on the wall.

climbs.name: Phone a Friend
climbs.fa: FA: Ryan Johnson, Eric Fazio-Rhicard (Apr. 2019). EB: Steve Johnson (1998)

content.description:
Short, powerful, and red in the face ... kind of like padre.

 Steve Johnson bolted and projected this line early in his climbing career before life, grad school, and fishing lured him away on a climbing hiatus. When he picked up the sport again he was more interested in establishing new, moderate and beginner friendly areas than finishing up old projects.

 Eric Fazio-Rhicard and Greg Kay revisited the wall in spring 2019 and re-climbed a few of the routes and thought, with a hardware upgrade, this orphan line could work out. Eric gave me a call and lured me off the couch long enough to help re-bolt and red point the line.

 It's no 4 star classic, but it's fun. Gracias padre.
content.location: Left of the central arete of the wall and right of the saguaro. Watch out for the saguaro.

climbs.name: Fast Eddy
climbs.fa: FA: Eddy Mofardin, Eric Fazio-Rhicard (2002). EB: Steve Johnson (1998).

content.description: Fun, thoughtful edge climbing from bottom to top.
content.location: Center left of wall. Begins off a small ledge.

content.description: Sunny and short wall on the east end of the Hairpin Rock formation. Clearly visible from the highway. A handful of sunny sport climbs make for a decent half day in the cold winter months.
